summary: AI-powered sports assistant app (Sportified) with sport selection, daily fitness goals (steps/squats/pushups) with mixed auto/manual logging, user accounts for saved profiles, and social features (friends + separate following/followers + private messaging).
architectural_notes: Platform limitation: cannot access phone motion sensors; true automatic step/squat/pushup tracking may require manual entry or data import instead.
Platform limitation: no WebSockets/real-time comms; chat must be implemented as non-real-time messaging (poll/fetch on open).

Sign-up is implemented as a first-time onboarding flow: user taps "New user? Sign-up" on sign-in screen, authenticates via Internet Identity, then completes onboarding fields (name, age, fitness goals, preferred sport) to create their profile.

existing_features.title: Set the application name to "Sportified" across user-facing UI (app title/header) and any visible branding text.
Implement user accounts with persistent profiles so a user’s data is saved and not lost across sessions, using Internet Identity for authentication.
Provide sport selection in the UI (e.g., badminton, basketball, football) and persist the user’s selected sport in their profile.
Implement daily fitness goals and activity tracking for steps, squats, and pushups, with simulated automatic step logging and manual logging for squats and pushups; persist logs per user and day.
Implement a friend system that is separate from following: users can search/discover other users, send friend requests, and accept/decline requests; maintain an accurate friends list per user.
Implement a following/followers system that is separate from friends: users can follow/unfollow other users and view follower and following lists.
Implement private messaging (non-real-time): users can send messages to other users and fetch conversation history when opening a chat screen; store messages per conversation in the backend.

Create core frontend screens and navigation for: sign-in, profile, sport selection, daily activity dashboard/logging, friends (requests + list), following/followers, and messages; ensure consistent loading/error/empty states using React Query.
Define and apply a coherent visual theme for Sportified (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) across all screens; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add generated static image assets (logo and background) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (e.g., in header/sign-in page) without routing images through the backend.
Update the Sign In screen to clearly distinguish between returning users and new users by adding a separate "New user? Sign up" option alongside the existing "Login with Internet Identity" flow.

Implement a first-time onboarding screen (separate from the existing profile setup dialog) that is used for new users after they authenticate with Internet Identity. The onboarding form must collect: name, age, fitness goals, and preferred sport.
Wire the "New user? Sign up" flow so that when a user chooses sign-up, they authenticate with Internet Identity first and are then taken directly to the onboarding screen to complete profile setup.
Update the frontend’s profile queries/mutations and profile editing UI to support the new profile fields (age and fitness goals) so users can view and edit them after onboarding.

Replace or rework the current authenticated-but-no-profile behavior (currently a modal ProfileSetupDialog) so it does not conflict with the new separate onboarding sign-up flow, while still preventing authenticated users without a profile from using the app without completing profile setup.

new_feature_requests.summary: Activity tracking: automatic logging for steps; manual logging for squats and pushups
User accounts/profiles so user data is saved and not lost
Friend system: friend requests and friends list
Private messaging (non-real-time, messages fetched when opening conversation)

Add first-time user sign-up/onboarding flow: sign-in screen distinguishes new vs returning users; new users authenticate with Internet Identity then complete onboarding form (name, age, fitness goals, preferred sport) to create profile
Extend the backend user profile model and related APIs to support storing age and fitness goals, and allow onboarding to create a profile with name, age, fitness goals, and preferred sport.
